Html:
First, thanks for this great add-in!

Is there a way to leverage the combining feature from the console?

A little background on what I'm trying to accomplish. Our team is setting up a continuous integration server and I want to be able to have the latest .less/.js files get pulled from source control repo and "compiled" at build time (since save-time compilation won't work in this scenario). I figure I can set up a post-build event to call the Chirpy.exe, but I'm not sure how to use the mash.chirp.config file, etc.

Is this possible? Or is there another approach that I can take?

Thanks,
Gregg

Console application support :

  1. config engine
  2. (Yahoo css minifier)YuiCssEngine
  3. (Yahoo javascript minifier) YuiJsEngine
  4. (google closure compiler) ClosureCompilerEngine
  5. (less) LessEngine
  6. (coffeScript) CoffeeScriptEngine
  7. UglifyEngine
  8. (Microsoft javascript minifier) MsJsEngine
  9. (Microsoft css minifier)MsCssEngine
  10. ViewEngine
